content:
Sure! Here are some suggestions for more challenging hikes in the Salt Lake City area:

1. Mount Olympus Trail: This 6.8-mile trail is a difficult but rewarding trek that takes you to the summit of Mount Olympus, which offers breathtaking views of the city and surrounding mountains. 2. Lake Blanche Trail: This 6.9-mile trail is a strenuous hike that takes you through beautiful alpine forests and ends at Lake Blanche, a stunning alpine lake surrounded by towering peaks. 3. Grandeur Peak Trail: This 6.2-mile trail is a challenging hike that takes you to the summit of Grandeur Peak, which offers panoramic views of the city and surrounding mountains. 4. Lone Peak Trail: This 10.4-mile trail is a difficult but rewarding hike that takes you to the summit of Lone Peak, which offers breathtaking views of the Wasatch Mountains. Before setting out on any of these more challenging hikes, make sure you are physically prepared and have the appropriate gear and supplies. Bring plenty of water and snacks, and be prepared for changing weather conditions. It's also a good idea to let someone know your hiking plans and expected return time.
